<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company&#146;s estimate of the long-term rate of return on plan assets was
8.75&nbsp;percent based on the target asset allocation. Expected returns on longer duration bonds are
based on yields to maturity of the bonds held at year-end. Expected returns on other assets are
based on a combination of long-term historical returns, actual returns on plan assets achieved over
the last ten years, current and expected market conditions, and expected value to be generated
through active management, currency overlay and securities lending programs. The Company&#146;s
annualized ten-year rate of return on plan assets as of December&nbsp;31, 2006, was approximately 11.8
percent.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Company&#146;s pension plan weighted-average asset allocations at December&nbsp;31, by asset category,
are as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="76%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">2006</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">2005</TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR><TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">Long duration bonds</DIV></TD>

    <TD align="right">100</TD>
    <TD nowrap>%</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">&nbsp;</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" style="border-top: 3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" style="border-top: 3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Company&#146;s target asset allocation is 40&nbsp;percent longer duration corporate and U.S.
government/agency bonds, 25&nbsp;percent U.S. value stocks, 20&nbsp;percent developed international stocks,
five percent emerging markets stocks and bonds, and ten percent alternative (private)&nbsp;investments.
Each asset class is actively managed and the plans&#146; assets have produced returns, net of management
fees, in excess of the expected rate of return over the last ten years. Stocks and emerging market
bonds are used to provide diversification and are expected to generate higher returns over the
long-term than longer duration U.S. bonds. Public stocks are managed using a value investment
approach in order to participate in the returns generated by stocks in the long-term, while
reducing year-over-year volatility. Longer duration U.S. bonds are used to partially hedge the
assets from declines in interest rates. Alternative (private)&nbsp;investments are used to provide
expected returns in excess of the public markets over the long-term. Additionally, the Company
engages currency overlay managers in an attempt to increase returns by protecting non-U.S. dollar
denominated assets from a rise in the relative value of the U.S. dollar. The Company also
participates in securities lending programs in order to generate additional income by loaning plan
assets to borrowers on a fully collateralized basis.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->77<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Company expects to contribute approximately $364&nbsp;million to its defined benefit pension plans
and $13&nbsp;million to its postretirement benefit plan in 2007. In addition to making contributions to
its postretirement benefit plan, the Company funds the majority of the benefit payments under this
plan. This estimate reflects the provisions of the Pension Funding Equity Act of 2004 and the
Pension Protection Act of 2006.

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>11. Intangible Assets</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Company had route acquisition costs (including international slots) of $829&nbsp;million as of
December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005 that are considered indefinite life assets under Financial Accounting
Standard 142, &#147;Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets&#148;. The Company&#146;s impairment analysis for route
acquisition costs did not result in an impairment charge in 2006 or 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The following tables provide information relating to the Company&#146;s amortized intangible assets as
of December&nbsp;31 (in millions):

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">$</TD>
    <TD align="right">331</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">$</TD>
    <TD align="right">365</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">&nbsp;</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
        <TD nowrap colspan="2" align="right" style="border-top: 3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
        <TD nowrap colspan="2" align="right" style="border-top: 3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
        <TD nowrap colspan="2" align="right" style="border-top: 3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Airport operating and gate lease rights are being amortized on a straight-line basis over 25&nbsp;years
to a zero residual value. The Company recorded amortization expense related to these intangible
assets of approximately $28&nbsp;million, $28&nbsp;million and $29&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively. The Company expects to record annual amortization expense of
approximately $28&nbsp;million in each of the next five years related to these intangible assets.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->79<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

</DIV>


<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company estimates during the next twelve months it will reclassify
from Accumulated other comprehensive loss into net earnings (loss)&nbsp;approximately $21&nbsp;million in net
gains related to its cash flow hedges.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->80<!-- /Folio -->

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, approximately 10&nbsp;million shares related to employee stock
options were not added to the denominator because the options&#146; exercise prices were greater than
the average market price of the common shares. Approximately 78&nbsp;million and 52&nbsp;million shares
issuable upon conversion of the Company&#146;s convertible notes, employee stock options and deferred
stock were not added to the denominator for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 and 2004,
respectively, because inclusion of such shares would be antidilutive.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>14. Segment Reporting</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Company&#146;s operations of American and AMR Eagle are treated as an integrated route network and
the route scheduling system maximizes the operating results of the Company. The Company&#146;s chief
operating decision maker makes resource allocation decisions to maximize the Company&#146;s consolidated
financial results. Based on the way the Company treats the network and the manner in which
resource allocation decisions are made, the Company has only one operating segment for financial
reporting purposes consisting of the operations of American and AMR Eagle.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">American is the largest scheduled passenger airline in the world. At the end of 2006, American
provided scheduled jet service to approximately 150 destinations throughout North America, the
Caribbean, Latin America, Europe and Asia. American is also one of the largest scheduled air
freight carriers in the world, providing a full range of freight and mail services to shippers
throughout its system. AMR Eagle owns two regional airlines, which do business as &#147;American Eagle&#148;
- - American Eagle Airlines, Inc. and Executive Airlines, Inc. The American Eagle<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">&#174;</SUP> carriers provide
connecting service from eight of American&#146;s high-traffic cities to smaller markets throughout the
United States, Canada, Mexico and the Caribbean.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->81<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>14. Segment Reporting (Continued)</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Revenues from other segments are below the quantitative threshold for determining reportable
segments and consist primarily of revenues from American Beacon Advisors, Inc. and Americas Ground
Services, Inc. The difference between the financial information of the Company&#146;s one reportable
segment and the financial information included in the accompanying consolidated statements of
operations and balance sheets as a result of these entities is not material.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Company&#146;s operating revenues by geographic region (as defined by the Department of

    <TD align="left">$</TD>
    <TD align="right">18,645</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Company attributes operating revenues by geographic region based upon the origin and
destination of each flight segment. The Company&#146;s tangible assets consist primarily of flight
equipment, which are mobile across geographic markets and, therefore, have not been allocated.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left"><A NAME="013"></A></DIV>
<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>ITEM 9. CHANGES IN AND DISAGREEMENTS WITH ACCOUNTANTS ON ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">None.
</DIV>

<!-- link2 "ITEM 9A. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES" -->
<DIV align="left"><A NAME="014"></A></DIV>
<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>ITEM 9A. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Management&#146;s Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The term &#147;disclosure controls and procedures&#148; is defined in Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) of the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934, or the Exchange Act. This term refers to the controls and
procedures of a company that are designed to ensure that information required to be disclosed by a
company in the reports that it files under the Exchange Act is recorded, processed, summarized and
reported within the time periods specified by the Securities and Exchange Commission. An evaluation
was performed under the supervision and with the participation of the Company&#146;s management,
including the Chief Executive Officer (CEO)&nbsp;and Chief Financial Officer (CFO), of the effectiveness
of the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures as of December&nbsp;31, 2006. Based on that
evaluation, the Company&#146;s management, including the CEO and CFO, concluded that the Company&#146;s
disclosure controls and procedures were effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2006. During the quarter
ending on December&nbsp;31, 2006, there was no change in the Company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Management of the Company is responsible for establishing and maintaining effective internal
control over financial reporting as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a-15(f) under the Securities Exchange Act of
1934. The Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting is designed to provide reasonable
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial
statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or
detect misstatements. Therefore, even those systems determined to be effective can provide only
reasonable assurance with respect to financial statement preparation and presentation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Management assessed the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as
of December&nbsp;31, 2006 using the criteria set forth in <I>Internal Control &#151; Integrated Framework</I>
issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission<I>. </I>Based on this
assessment, management believes that, as of December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting was effective based on those criteria.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Management&#146;s assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting as of
December&nbsp;31, 2006, has been audited by Ernst &#038; Young LLP, the independent registered public
accounting firm who also audited the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements. Ernst &#038; Young
LLP&#146;s attestation report on management&#146;s assessment of the Company&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting appears below.
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="35%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

    <TD colspan="3" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD colspan="3" align="left">Gerard J. Arpey&nbsp;</TD>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="35%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">The Board
of Directors and Shareholders<br>
AMR Corporation
</DIV>



<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We have audited management&#146;s assessment, included in the accompanying Management&#146;s Report on
Internal Control over Financial Reporting, that AMR Corporation maintained effective internal
control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2006, based on criteria established in Internal
Control&#151;Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway
Commission (the COSO criteria). AMR Corporation&#146;s management is responsible for maintaining
effective internal control over financial reporting and for its assessment of the effectiveness of
internal control over financial reporting. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on
management&#146;s assessment and an opinion on the effectiveness of the company&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting based on our audit.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight
Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain
reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was
maintained in all material respects. Our audit included obtaining an understanding of internal
control over financial reporting, evaluating management&#146;s assessment, testing and evaluating the
design and operating effectiveness of internal control, and performing such other procedures as we
considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis
for our opinion.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial
statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A
company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1)
pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the
transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance that
transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance
with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company
are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company;
and (3)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized
acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#146;s assets that could have a material effect on the
financial statements.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or
detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are
subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that
the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In our opinion, management&#146;s assessment that AMR Corporation maintained effective internal control
over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2006, is fairly stated, in all material respects, based
on the COSO criteria. Also, in our opinion, AMR Corporation maintained, in all material respects,
effective internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2006, based on the COSO
criteria<B>.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight
Board (United States), the consolidated balance sheets of AMR Corporation as of December&nbsp;31, 2006
and 2005 and the related consolidated statements of operations, stockholders&#146; equity (deficit)&nbsp;and
cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 and related financial
statement schedule and our report dated February&nbsp;21, 2007 expressed an unqualified opinion thereon.
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="35%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U><B>Exhibit</B></U>

<DIV align="center">

<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">

    <TD width="94%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Head -->

to AMR&#146;s Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-4, file number 33-55191.</div></TD>

    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">10.126

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">




<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>AMR CORPORATION<BR>
Schedule&nbsp;II &#151; Valuation and Qualifying Accounts and Reserves<BR>
(in millions)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="28%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>

</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.9
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>d43815exv10w9.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DEFERRED COMPENSATION AGREEMENT - JOHN W. BUCHMANN
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w9</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.9
</DIV>


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">November&nbsp;29, 2006
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Mr.&nbsp;John W. Bachmann<BR>
Edward Jones<BR>
12555 Manchester Road<BR>
St. Louis, MO 63131-3279

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Dear John:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This will confirm the following agreement relating to the deferral of your director&#146;s
fees in 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;All
director&#146;s
fees and retainers
(&#147;Fees&#148;) payable to you in connection
with your service on the boards of directors (including committees of such boards) of AMR
Corporation and American Airlines, Inc. for the period January&nbsp;1, 2007 through December&nbsp;31, 2007,
will be deferred and paid to you in accordance with this letter agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Fees will be converted to Stock Equivalent Units in accordance with the Directors&#146; Stock
Equivalent Purchase Plan, a copy of which is attached hereto as
Exhibit&nbsp;A (the &#147;Plan&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;On the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day after the date when you cease to be a Director of AMR
Corporation, the Stock Equivalent Units accrued in 2007 pursuant to the Plan will be converted to
cash and paid to you by multiplying the number of such Stock Equivalent Units by the arithmetic
mean of the high and the low of AMR stock (&#147;fair market
value&#148;) during the month when
you ceased to be a Director of AMR Corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;In the event of your death, the number of Stock Equivalent Units as of your date of death
will be multiplied by the fair market value of AMR stock during the calendar month immediately
preceding your death, and the amount paid to Katharine Bachmann. The payment contemplated by this
paragraph 4 will be made on the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day following the date of your death.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the foregoing is satisfactory to you, please indicate by signing one of the originals (two
are enclosed) and returning it to me.
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

will confirm the following agreement relating to the deferral of your director&#146;s
fees in 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;All

&#147;Plan&#148;).

immediately preceding your death, and the amount paid to Lois Brennan. The payment contemplated by
this paragraph 3 will be made on the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day following the date of your death.

cash and paid to you by multiplying the number of such Stock Equivalent Units by the arithmetic

preceding your death, and the amount paid to Molly Boren. The payment contemplated by this
paragraph 4 will be made on the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day following the date of your death.

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.34
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>d43815exv10w34.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DEFERRED COMPENSATION AGREEMENT - ARMANDO M. CODINA
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w34</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.34
</DIV>


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">December&nbsp;21, 2006
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Mr.&nbsp;Armando M. Codina<BR>
Chairman<BR>
Codina Group, Inc.<BR>
355 Alhambra Circle, Suite&nbsp;900<BR>
Coral Gables, FL 33134

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Dear Armando:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to deferral agreements (collectively, the &#147;Deferral Agreements&#148;) entered into prior
to the date of this letter agreement and the Directors&#146; Stock Equivalent Purchase Plan, as amended
(the &#147;Plan&#148;), you have previously deferred, for the period of time specified in such Deferral
Agreements, the payment of fees and retainers payable to you in connection with your service on the
boards of directors (including committees of such boards) of AMR Corporation and American Airlines,
Inc. (collectively, the &#147;Fees&#148;) for years prior to 2007, and you agreed that the Fees would be
converted to Stock Equivalent Units in accordance with the Plan. You would like to amend the date
for the distribution of the Stock Equivalent Units corresponding to the Fees that have not been
paid to you as of the date of this letter agreement (collectively, the &#147;Outstanding Stock
Equivalent Units&#148;) as described below.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;Consistent with the exemption under Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as
amended for amounts payable prior to January&nbsp;1, 2005, all Outstanding Stock Equivalent Units
accrued pursuant to the Plan for your board service for periods preceding January&nbsp;1, 2005 will be
deferred and paid to you as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day after the date when you cease to be a Director of AMR
Corporation, the Outstanding Stock Equivalent Units accrued for such period pursuant to the Plan
will be converted to cash and paid to you by multiplying the number of such Outstanding Stock
Equivalent Units by the arithmetic mean of the high and the low of AMR Corporation stock (&#147;fair
market value&#148;) during the month when you ceased to be a Director of AMR Corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of your death, the number of such Outstanding Stock Equivalent Units as of your
date of death will be multiplied by the fair market value of AMR stock during the calendar month
immediately preceding your death, and the amount paid to Margarita Codina. The payment
contemplated by this paragraph will be made on the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day following the date of your death.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;In accordance with Internal Revenue Service Notice 2006-79, the Outstanding Stock
Equivalent Units accrued pursuant to the Plan for your board service for the periods January&nbsp;1,
2005 through December&nbsp;31, 2005 and January&nbsp;1, 2006 through December&nbsp;31, 2006 will be deferred and
paid to you as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day after the date when you cease to be a Director of AMR
Corporation, the Outstanding Stock Equivalent Units accrued for such period pursuant to the Plan
will be converted to cash and paid to you by multiplying the number of such Outstanding Stock
Equivalent Units by the fair market value during the month when you ceased to be a Director of AMR
Corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of your death, the number of such Outstanding Stock Equivalent Units as of your
date of death will be multiplied by the fair market value of AMR stock during the calendar month
immediately preceding your death, and the amount paid to Margarita Codina. The payment
contemplated by this paragraph will be made on the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day following the date
of your death.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the foregoing is satisfactory to you, please indicate by signing one of the originals (two
are enclosed) and returning it to me.
</DIV>

</DIV>


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">November&nbsp;29, 2006

130 Fifth Avenue<BR>

will confirm the following agreement relating to the deferral of your director&#146;s
fees in 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;All
director&#146;s fees and retainers (&#147;Fees&#148;) payable to you in connection
with your service on the boards of directors (including committees of such boards) of AMR
Corporation and American Airlines, Inc. for the period January&nbsp;1, 2007 through December&nbsp;31, 2007,
will be deferred and paid to you in accordance with this letter agreement.
</DIV>

Exhibit&nbsp;A (the &#147;Plan&#148;).
</DIV>

Corporation, the Stock Equivalent Units accrued in 2007 pursuant to the Plan will be converted to
cash and paid to you by multiplying the number of such Stock Equivalent Units by the arithmetic
mean of the high and the low of AMR stock (&#147;fair market value&#148;) during the month when
you ceased to be a Director of AMR Corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;In the event of your death, the number of Stock Equivalent Units as of your date of death

preceding your death, and the amount paid to Barbara Graves. The payment contemplated by this
paragraph 4 will be made on the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day following the date of your death.

fees in 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;All
director<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#146;</FONT>s
fees and retainers
(<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#147;</FONT>Fees<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#148;</FONT>) payable to you in connection
with your service on the boards of directors (including committees of such boards) of AMR
Corporation and American Airlines, Inc. for the period January&nbsp;1, 2007 through December&nbsp;31, 2007,
will be deferred and paid to you in accordance with this letter agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Fees will be converted to Stock Equivalent Units in accordance with the Directors&#146; Stock
Equivalent Purchase Plan, a copy of which is attached hereto as
Exhibit&nbsp;A (the
<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#147;</FONT>Plan<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#148;</FONT>).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;On the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day after the date when you cease to be a Director of AMR
Corporation, the Stock Equivalent Units accrued in 2007 pursuant to the Plan will be converted to
cash and paid to you by multiplying the number of such Stock Equivalent Units by the arithmetic
mean of the high and the low of AMR stock
(<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#147;</FONT>fair
market value<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#148;</FONT>) during the month when
you ceased to be a Director of AMR Corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;In the event of your death, the number of Stock Equivalent Units as of your date of death
will be multiplied by the fair market value of AMR stock during the calendar month immediately
preceding your death, and the amount paid to Anne Purcell. The payment contemplated by this
paragraph 4 will be made on the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day following the date of your death.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>

originals (two are enclosed) and returning it to me.
</DIV>

<DESCRIPTION>DEFERRED COMPENSATION AGREEMENT - JUDITH RODIN
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w69</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.69
</DIV>


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">November&nbsp;29, 2006
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Judith Rodin, PhD.<BR>
President<BR>
The Rockefeller Foundation<BR>
420 Fifth Avenue<BR>
New York, NY 10018

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Dear Judith:

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
will confirm the following agreement relating to the deferral of your
director<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#146;</FONT>s
fees in 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;All
director<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#146;</FONT>s
fees and retainers
(<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#147;</FONT>Fees<FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#148;</FONT>) payable to you in connection
with your service on the boards of directors (including committees of such boards) of AMR
Corporation and American Airlines, Inc. for the period January&nbsp;1, 2007 through December&nbsp;31, 2007,
will be deferred and paid to you in accordance with this letter agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Interest will be accrued on the amounts to be paid on a deferred basis pursuant to
paragraph 1 above, from the date such fees would otherwise have been paid to the date actually
paid, at the prime rate which The Chase Manhattan Bank (National Association) from time to time
charges in New York for 90-day loans to responsible commercial borrowers, such interest to be
compounded monthly.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;The total amount to be paid on a deferred basis plus the aggregate amount of interest
accrued thereon will be paid to you in a lump sum distribution on the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day
after the date when you cease to be a Director of AMR Corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;In the event of your death, the number of Stock Equivalent Units as of your date of death
will be multiplied by the fair market value of AMR stock during the calendar month immediately
preceding your death, and the amount paid to the Trustees under your Revocable Agreement of Trust,
dated September&nbsp;15, 1997, as amended February&nbsp;20, 2004, Judith Rodin Settlor and Trustee.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

are enclosed) and returning it to me.
</DIV>

    <TD colspan="2" align="left">Matthew K. Rose&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR>
    <TD align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>

</TR>

    <TD valign="top" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.78
<SEQUENCE>14
<FILENAME>d43815exv10w78.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DEFERRED COMPENSATION AGREEMENT - ROGER T. STAUBACH
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w78</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.78
</DIV>


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">November&nbsp;29, 2006
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Mr.&nbsp;Roger T. Staubach<BR>
Chairman &#038; CEO<BR>
The Staubach Company<BR>
15601 Dallas Parkway<BR>
Suite&nbsp;400<BR>
Addison, TX 75001

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Dear Roger:

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This will confirm the following agreement relating to the deferral of your director&#146;s
fees in 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;All director&#146;s fees and retainers &#147;Fees&#148; payable to you in connection
with your service on the boards of directors (including committees of such boards) of AMR
Corporation and American Airlines, Inc. for the period January&nbsp;1, 2007 through December&nbsp;31, 2007,
will be deferred and paid to you in accordance with this letter agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Fees will be converted to Stock Equivalent Units in accordance with the Directors&#146; Stock
Equivalent Purchase Plan, a copy of which is attached hereto as Exhibit&nbsp;A (the &#147;Plan&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;On the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day after the date when you cease to be a Director of AMR
Corporation, the Stock Equivalent Units accrued in 2007 pursuant to the Plan will be converted to
cash and paid to you by multiplying the number of such Stock Equivalent Units by the arithmetic
mean of the high and the low of AMR stock (&#147;fair market value&#148;) during the month when
you ceased to be a Director of AMR Corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;In the event of your death, the number of Stock Equivalent Units as of your date of death
will be multiplied by the fair market value of AMR stock during the calendar month immediately
preceding your death, and the amount paid to Marianne Staubach. The payment contemplated by this
paragraph 4 will be made on the 30<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> business day following the date of your death.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the foregoing is satisfactory to you, please indicate by signing one of the originals (two
are enclosed) and returning it to me.
</DIV>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.127
<SEQUENCE>15
<FILENAME>d43815exv10w127.htm
<DESCRIPTION>AMENDED 2007 ANNUAL INCENTIVE PLAN FOR AMERICAN
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w127</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.127
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">AMERICAN AIRLINES<BR>
2007 ANNUAL INCENTIVE PLAN
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Background</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">As part of the restructuring process that took place in April&nbsp;2003, three new broad-based variable
compensation plans were created: the Broad Based Employee Stock Option Plan, a new Profit Sharing
Plan and the Annual Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148; or &#147;AIP&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The framework for the Plan was developed during the restructuring, but the specific plan metrics
were left to the discretion of the Board of Directors (sometimes referred to as the &#147;Board&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Board has determined that for 2007 there will be two components to the Plan &#151; customer service
and financial. While related, the two components will be treated separately. The financial
component will provide an award if the company meets annual financial goals. The customer service
component will provide an award if the company meets customer satisfaction and dependability goals,
regardless of its financial performance. Providing the opportunity for a customer service payout
without meeting financial hurdles recognizes that the company&#146;s performance in the two areas most
important to our customers &#151; dependability and customer satisfaction &#151; will contribute to
improved profitability.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">These broad-based compensation plans have been designed to allow all employees throughout the
American Airlines team to share in the company&#146;s success. The Plan provides the opportunity to
share immediately in that success by taking concrete steps in each employee&#146;s everyday work that
will move the company towards profitability.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">With input from our employees, the unions and the Board, these broad-based variable compensation
programs will continue to evolve. Today, they form the building blocks necessary to ensure that
everyone is able to share in the company&#146;s success.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Definitions</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Capitalized terms not otherwise defined in the Plan will have the meanings set forth in the 2003
Employee Stock Incentive Plan (the &#147;2003 Stock Plan&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;AMR&#148; is defined as AMR Corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Affiliate&#148; is defined as a subsidiary of AMR or any entity that is designated by the Committee as
a participating employer under the Plan, provided that AMR directly or indirectly owns at least 20%
of the combined voting power of all classes of stock of such entity.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;American&#148; is defined as AMR less AMR subsidiaries other than American Airlines, Inc. and its
subsidiaries.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;American Airlines&#148; is defined as American Airlines, Inc.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;American&#146;s Pre-Tax Earnings Margin&#148; is a percentage and is defined as American&#146;s earnings,
relative to its revenues, before any applicable income tax expense and is exclusive of any profit
sharing payments, payments under the Plan and any special, extraordinary or one-time items as may
be determined by the Committee in its discretion, after consultation with AMR&#146;s independent
auditors.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Committee&#148; is defined as the Compensation Committee of the AMR Board of Directors.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Competitor&#148; is defined as one of AirTran Airways, Alaska Airlines, Continental Airlines, Delta Air
Lines, Frontier Airlines, JetBlue Airways, Northwest Airlines, Southwest Airlines, United Air Lines
and US Airways. During the Plan year, the Committee delegates to the Incentive Compensation
Committee the authority to modify the universe of companies that comprise the definition of
&#147;Competitor&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Disabled&#148;, &#147;Disability&#148; or variants thereof will have the meaning as defined in section
409(a)(2)(C) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &#147;Code&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;DOT Rank&#148; is defined as American&#146;s relative rank with respect to the Competitors in the category
of &#147;arrivals&#043;14 (A&#043;14)&#148; as determined by the U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT). This monthly
ranking is based on DOT&#146;s aggregated A&#043;14 data for the period January&nbsp;1, 2007 through December&nbsp;31,
2007 inclusive. To the extent that at any point during the year a Competitor ceases to report A&#043;14
data, it will be excluded from the calculation for the month in which it ceases to report A&#043;14
data, and for future months, until it begins to report A&#043;14 data for a full month.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Eligible Earnings&#148; is defined by the nature of the work group. For employees who are represented
by a union, the definition of Eligible Earnings will be the definition contained in the Letter of
Agreement between the union and the company. For employees who are not represented by a union the
definition of Eligible Earnings will be identical to the term &#147;Qualified Earnings&#148; under the 2003
American Airlines Employee Profit Sharing Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Fund&#148; is defined as the fund, if any, accumulated in accordance with this Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Letters of Agreement&#148; is defined as the agreements reached with the Allied Pilots Association,
Association of Professional Flight Attendants and the Transport Workers Union during the April&nbsp;2003
restructuring process that define the framework of the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Measure&#148; is defined, as appropriate, as American&#146;s Pre-Tax Earnings Margin, DOT Rank or Survey
America Rank.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Named Executive Officers&#148; is defined as the officers of American who are named in the AMR proxy
statement that reports income for the year in which awards under the Plan are earned.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Other Cash Compensation Programs&#148; is defined as cash payments to management employees that are not
predicated upon the criteria and thresholds contained in the Plan. Per discussions and as specified
in the Letters of Agreement, this term does not include salary, stock-based compensation,
severance, retirement benefits or deferred payments of base compensation, or eligible cash bonuses
from prior years.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Profit Sharing Plan&#148; is defined as the 2007 Employee Profit Sharing Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Survey America Rank&#148; is defined as American&#146;s relative rank with respect to its Competitors in the
category of &#147;Overall Travel Experience&#148;, using a blended ranking of first class and coach cabin,
as reported in Plog Inc.&#146;s Survey America. The Survey America ranking is based on monthly data for
American and the Competitors for the period January&nbsp;1, 2007 through December&nbsp;31, 2007, inclusive.
To the extent that at any point during such year a Competitor ceases to participate, it will be
excluded from the calculation for the month in which it ceased to participate, and for future
months, until it begins to participate again for a full month period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Target Award&#148; is defined as the award (stated as a percentage of Eligible Earnings) for an
eligible participant when target level is achieved on the financial measure. The Target Award is
determined by the employee&#146;s job level.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->3<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Plan Measures</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">As outlined earlier, the Plan is comprised of two components: customer service and financial.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Customer Service Component
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The customer service component of the Plan will include two performance metrics &#151; customer
satisfaction and dependability. The Plan will reward employees if American achieves at least one
of the two metrics.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The customer satisfaction metric will be based on American&#146;s Survey America Rank. The
dependability metric will be based on American&#146;s DOT Rank.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Monthly awards will be based on the <B><I>higher </I></B>of the monthly rankings for DOT Rank or for Survey
America Rank, as per the payout schedule below. These award levels are the same for all employees
regardless of full-time or part-time status or job level.
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="95%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3">Payout</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3">Per Person</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="left" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">Monthly Rank</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">Per Month</TD>
    <TD align="center">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">First</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right">$</TD>
    <TD align="right">100</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">Second &#151; Third</DIV></TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">Fourth &#151; Sixth</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right">$</TD>
    <TD align="right">25</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If both metrics are achieved in any single month, the awards will <B><I>not </I></B>be additive. Awards will be
based solely on the higher ranking of the two metrics.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Awards under the customer service component will be paid regardless of performance under the
financial component. The awards under the customer service component will be paid, net of
applicable taxes, within 75&nbsp;days after DOT Rank and Survey America Rank are available and employee
eligibility is established...
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><I>For example:</I>
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="75%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="0%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="0%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" colspan="3" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">Monthly Ranking</TD>

    <TD align="center" valign="top">4</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">March</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">3</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">1</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">1</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">1<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">st</SUP> place</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">=</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">$</TD>
    <TD align="right">100</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">&nbsp;</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
